front.title: On the Scalability of Internet Routing

abstract.t: There has been much discussion over the last years about the overallscalability of the Internet routing system. Some have argued thatthe resources required to maintain routing tables in the core of theInternet are growing faster than available technology will be able tokeep up. Others disagree with that assessment. This documentattempts to describe the factors that are placing pressure on therouting system and the growth trends behind those factors.
